text: Hi Guys, I am new to HubSpot and got stuck on create new app could someone please help me out

Hello guys! :wave: :wave:
Is there a way to redirect users from a certain country that want to visit my page to another page? I want to block certain country from visiting my website and redirect them to our Twitter post as they are being scammed by some con artists. Thank you :)

There are various ways you can handle it:
• Using smart content/modules in your page, so if a user is from a specific country you can show a different content (maybe a text that explains why the can't see the page)
• Detect user IP with Hubl (beware that this will disable page caching and decrese performance) or JS and then redirect to another page (not optimal if done through js as users can still disable js and see the page)

please check installation and error message properly.
install node and yarn
install git hub and change terninal to bash terminal and follow HubSpot command

<https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx&scope=contacts%20automation&redirect_uri=https://www.example.com/|https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxx[…]e=contacts%20automation&redirect_uri=https://www.example.com/>

Here where I can set the client secret ?

I get a weird error using export API :see_no_evil:  I provide bearer token in headers as it stated in docs, but that's what I get:
```{"status":"error","message":"Csrf token is missing from the request.","correlationId":"eead86bb-8954-4d5a-a99f-728365dd4752","engagement":{"service-to-service":"service-to-service not engaged. Metadata for service-to-service request not found.","hapikey":"Not engaged, auth is missing","oauth-token":"Not engaged, auth is missing","app-cookie":"Engaged","internal-cookie":"internal-cookie not engaged. Cookie not found in the request."}}```
Don't you have an idea what can it be?
Which endpoint are you using? Looks like you're trying to use the internal exports endpoint
I'm using the one from documentation: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/exports/export/async>

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
I suggest you copy the authorization url in the app settings page under AUTH
